113211222112.content:
[Suggested music - WarioWare: Smooth Moves - Tomorrow Hill: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KTjltCVO... ]

"Ashley, I found more!... What?"

The witch's assistant, who came in laughing and beaming, stared at the scene before him. His mistress many times her normal size, struggling to break from the bits of the mansion that still covered her. She averted her gaze, as old bits of wood crumbled around her elbows. His old boss from WarioWare, dashing ahead in a frenzy. He scratched his head. "Uh, sh-should I come back later?"

*BUMP*

In the darkness - and staring behind him at the girl's growth reaching its climax - Wario didn't notice Red, fluttering close to the ground. He crashed into the imp, releasing the Crescent Moon Shard.

"Wah!" He got to his muscular legs. "Go away, I'm making a daring getaway!" The thief reached to the ground to grab his dropped treasure...

Only to find multiple Crescent Moon Shards. A whole pile of them! They each glistened in the moonlight, all just as brilliant as the stolen one. His jaw dropped. His eggshell eyes scanned the pile top to bottom... And pointed to Red, who smiled sheepishly. "Buh... Wah..."

Ashley rose up, and trod towards her returned servant. Her simple boost tore the gigantic mansion from the ground, and brought it with her, hanging around her waist as if it were part of her dress. The fall of her legs made floorboards fall to the ground. "More crescents? Where... did you find these?" Her face lit up, only slightly moistened from her panic before.

Attempting to keep his dignity, Wario added a "Yeah, tell us!" as he dusted himself off.

Under both their stares, Red laughed, sweat dripping down his forehead. "Uh, first, mind tellin' me why Wario's here, and why Ashley's so... big-boned?"

He grumbled: "Because that shard's worth big money!"

She whispered: "That shard holds mysterious magic..."

He blinked, before shaking his head. "That shard is fool's gold!"

Both WarioWare employees froze. They looked at one another, desperate for some sense of sanity.

The imp pointed to the pile of glimmering crescents, prodding it with his pitchfork. "The villagers just import bananas from Kongo Bongo and paint them sparkly. The potion recipes using them were scams to drive their price up!" He seemed a little TOO happy with himself saying this.

"What." Ashley's eyes flashed crimson. Without moving a muscle, the entire manor crumbled into a million pieces from the sheer force of her rage and surprise. "So my potion... Was never... Going to work?" In the middle of every sentence fragment, she inhaled deeply, pulling clouds out of the sky.

"Ashley..." He flew up, way up past her fluttering dress, to pat her head. "I'm really, really sorry about that."

Wario chuckled, scooping as many of the glimmering shards. "Well, plenty o' dumb witches to sell these to! Where'd you pick them up?"

Red lit up. "A nice reporter gave them to me. Or was that a photographer... Pop star... Mona! All three of those. She used them in an investigative report on the scam." He shrugged. "That's how I learned about them. Now the news is out, they're a dime a dozen."

"WHAAAA?" The knees buckled behind pink trousers. Slowly, he bowed to the grassy ground. The man curled into a ball, cradling himself. He'd faced paralyzing fear, crushing pressure, near-death situations... But this struck him right in his heart, the very basest of his fears. He couldn't make money off these! made him feel weak and small and insignificant.

And when he was much taller than Red, no less!

The night was old, nearing its end. In the far East, sun began to rise, brightening the cheeks of large and small alike. The group squinted at the newly-birthed light. An unfamiliar warmth lit them up, drying their tears.

"Hah..."

A muted hint of what might be halfway towards a chuckle. It trembled through the air and ground, shaking both guys. Even the gigantic witch looked surprised. When Wario raised his head to look up, something was fundamentally twisted and wrong about the girl. What happened to her clammy, cold skin? Where had the dust across her neckerchief floated off to? Where was she hiding that distant, scornful gaze?

Only the hint of a smile remained there. "You still look pathetic."

He dusted himself off, gritting his teeth. "Makes two of us. What was the potion for, anyway?"

She looked to the clouds, lips pressed shut. "I don't... remember."

Her demonic helper chirped up in her place: "It was to cure your loneliness, wasn't it?" He yelped as Ashley stared him down.

Wario shrugged. "Bah, why don'tcha join a tennis or golf club? Bet I could squeeze you into a roster when Mario isn't looking!"

Her eyes glowed in the sun for a moment, before they turned away. "Whatever. If I find any ingredients there, I keep them."

His grimace slowly showed the hint of a grin. "Wahah, I've looked everywhere for treasure at the courses already. Steal whatever you want."

Red joined the smiles, looking out. "Gosh, that's pretty..."

With care - holding him between fingers, putting the right amount of support on his back - Ashley picked her former boss up. She placed him carefully by her shoulder, as he tucked himself into her neckerchief's folds. For just a moment, from common pain, the world wasn't as dark.

Waves in the west crashed gently, painted in purple. The raised position gave a glorious view of Diamond City, lights from the homes just turning on. Everything they knew was in this small, precious diorama of life before them.

Ashley stepped towards the sun, slow and deliberate. The smile still hadn't faded from her lips.

"...So, Red. This way to Crescent Moon Village?"

Red nodded. "Huh? You want to go there?"

Wario grinned knowingly. "Yeah, you're heading the right way. You gonna crush all those losers who cheated us?"

Ashley shook her head, nearly tossing Red off. "Not all. You can kill some of them yourself if you want." She tapped her dark hair, stroking the demon into it. "Red, what are some potions I can make with Crescent Moon Villagers?"

Red broke out in a cold sweat. "C-come on, a whole village just for some swindlers?"

Wario jumped up and down. "Hey! That's Hotel Future! I stayed there when I was renovating my mansion into my house!" He gazed happily. "They charged me a fortune. Stomp it down."

The imp froze. "Wh-what?"

*BOOOM*

Ashley smiled. "I'm sure a spell can fix that later."

Wario guffawed. "Wahahah, it's so good being on the other end of it! Hey, do 1 Chance Mansion next!"

Red screeched futilely, as they stomped into the distance, laughing together. "Wario... Ashley... Oh, maaan, you guys are horrible..."

Far off in the distance lay the big leagues - the REAL big leagues, making the princesses look like shrimps. Guys who build whole empires littered with coins on the streets, waiting for Wario to snatch them up. Big shots seated way-too-comfortably in thrones, doing nothing but kidnapping people.

Past a sea of bubbling lava, over fleets of airships getting in gear, and through a stained-glass window with Bowser's grinning face, Wario flew into his target. The fabled Another Castle, the holding place of some poor, kidnapped princess - and more importantly, a stolen power star. Its intruder slid across the crimson carpet, seeming to welcome him into this realm of impossibly-distant ceilings, and walls covered in spikes larger than his body.

A Goomba marching by towering jade door pulled his attention. Something good in there - something that the castle's owner didn't want intruders to take. The mushroomy guard took notice of this miniature thief, and charged forward - only for Wario to leap on its head, squashing the thing underneath a harsh ground-pound. He slid underneath the crack.

A blast of raw, humid air hit his nose, making his mustache nearly wilt. Those flaming deathtraps must have been on particularly hard in this room. The perfect atmosphere for a final confrontation between two rivals... Which Wario was totally going to crash. Navigating through the hazy area, the heat distorted his view far away. Something green and black shifted around, getting closer, then further from him. A thin line of cracks lay in the ground where this creature's tower-like legs had been pacing.

"Gah! This 'Bowsette' joke's gone far enough! I'm gettin' sick of it!"

That super-collider voice, echoing off the old concrete, stopped Wario in his tracks. His back slinked up against a wall, tense shoulders raised to his chins.

Between thumps in the distance and pounding pulses, the swindler registered some bass growls. It sounded like one of those broads he went golfing with... No, it was too throaty and deep for that. Or was that just how sound worked at this size?

Thud. THUD. SCRUNCH - a stone tile crumbled underfoot like an eggshell. "Get off my head, dumb thingamabob! Do you know who I am?"

The ground shook stronger than if a POW block hit it - knocking the intruder gut-first onto the cracked stone. He wobbled softly, trying to re-orient himself towards the right path. Just when the world had stopped spinning, a sputter of flames behind the woman cast an all-devouring, angular shadow over them both. From great leaps and bounds away, the resonating THUMP of a mighty backside slamming into a seat rang through his pointed ears. The throne's material screeched against the force of her bulbous, gargantuan rear, its hefty weight shifting and twitching restlessly. In a throne of bone and leather, slouched the ruler of the castle...

"Peach? Whah?" Dashing forward with his hand at his eyebrow, the yellow pseudo-plumber's squinted pupils navigated the titanic woman. Black heels - the cause of the tremors before - each flew into the air, and on a shell-shaped footrest, shifting and grinding for comfort. The princess' pitch-black dress bunched up at her lap like a series of winding hillocks, curving around a pair of mountains greater than Mt. Lavalava - and more furious, the flesh and muscle quaking with every deep breath.

At this sight, Wario licked his lips, cheeks lifted in a wide smile - his heart racing by the display of beauty before him. The power star gleamed right in the cleavage, illuminating the leathery tit flesh - along with the key attached to it. Dollar signs rolled in his eyes, powering his stubby legs to push closer. But at the footstool. He'd be rich; but he'd have to scale this Peachy tower of folding fabrics. It was a huge drop from up high... Was it really worth the risk climbing up Princess Peach?

...No, that was wrong. This wasn't Peach, the shrunken adventurer realized. Old Princess Toadstool in a cage to the corner, face in her hands. Crud – did this mean Mario was coming? He had to grab his priz fast, and get out. But as he approached, he wondered: who the heck was this woman he stood below, stormclouds spewing from her toothy snarl?

"I'll tell you who I am - Bowser, King of Awesome! Grown Toads tremble at my name! So get off me, Stupor Crown!" The gigantic Bowsette slammed her heel off the footrest - pinning Wario beneath its hefty weight without noticing. He struggled against the slick black pillar from the sky, feeling intense pressure on his stomach and the breakfasts contained within. His head spun - were his brains knocked out by that blow, or did this dame just call herself "Bowser"? What had just happened to him?

From behind a giant pair of locked, green doors, Kamek knocked. "Lord Bowser! Er, Lady Bowsette? Your nastiness, the Hyper Final Boss Weapon is ready for your testing!"

The monolithic monarch's bushy brows framed a pair of blue reptilian eyes, larger than the greatest food plates Wario had ever gobbled garlic from. The shrunk pupils darted everywhere - as if trying to escape their sockets. Her legs stood stiff and motionless - their tension pulverizing their unintentional victim - her tail twitched back and forth, sounding like great thunderclaps. "Test it yourself! The kingdom can't see its king until she's taken this crown off!" After another unsuccessful attempt at removing it, she stomped the ground again - squeezing Wario like a squeaky toy, pushing the air out of him completely.

The Magikoopa paused before answering. "The soldiers are begging for their leader. What should I tell them?"

"Why? So they can stare at me without scales? So they can chortle at how soft I look? So they can double-cross me now that I can't scare 'em into submission?" The spike-collared mountain ran her hands over her unfamiliar, smooth legs, twisting them in disgust. From the corner, Peach blushed. The simple tug dragged the thief across the floor with the shoe, smearing him. "Tell 'em I'm busy training, that I'm more furious than ever, and that any Goomba that barges in entitled to a Bowser Beatdown!"

For emphasis, she stomped the ground a few times - each pound, Wario found bones he didn't even know he had cracking apart under pressure. The echoing THWOOM made it impossible for him to get his balance again. Kamek gave few words before departing: "Bowsette... You'll have to come out of your shell sometime."

"Just make me!!" Flames erupted from her shout, splattering across the door. Each skyscraper-like arm, topped with a spiked cuff, alternated between itching over her monstrously well-defined torso, picking bits of drumsticks from her guillotine-like teeth, and clawing desperately at her headpiece: a glowing crown with a pink mushroom at the center. The rapid twists and angry grunts all transferred to her underfoot intruder, grinding his gut flat - and sending dirt raining onto his rosy nose. Sweat covered Wario's brow as he tried to force it off - but even this transformed Koopa Queen's heel outmatched his whole body. So it was that crown's magic that transformed him...

"This dumb powerup was supposed to make Mario run screaming! Like the bells and cherries! But it's just sucked all the rugged charm from my bod!" The tyrannical tower tossed her fists out in a tantrum. With a fire-laden groan, her soles stamped on the ground like a heavy metal drummer.

"What am I supposed to do – beat Mario with tea parties?" The rapid THUDTHUDTHUD against the harsh flooring drove their mustached victim dizzy, every impact hitting him in a new pressure point. His calls of "WAH" were each choked silent by a new twisting step on his lungs. The dark plain of pain practically pancaked him, lifting him with the last few horrifying THUDs.

"Erm..." Peach, from her cage, raised a dainty hand with the volume and audacity of a Mouser. "If the tea were warm enough, it might hurt."

Bowsette's mania paused. "Hhrm, diabolical... and tasty..." Picturing a scorching teacup, she rubbed her slender chin, and folded a long leg up to the shell footrest.

With a whizz in his ears, a breath of tepid-but-satisfying air in his face, and a flashing blur of lava and grey walls, Wario was lifted up with the sole. Once his head stopped spinning, he realized: he'd made it higher! Excellent! The Power Star's glow reinvigorated him. Focusing that newfound energy into a hard push, stumbled off the pillar skewering him, and jumped onto the furniture.

It was lucky he bumbled out - one breath later, the same heel stomped down again. "ARGH!" Bass snarls emerged from her lips, cinders flaring around the caverns of her nostrils. "Tea parties aren't the point! This body's just too puny!"

The invader stood before the "puny" body, its heavy girth casting a shadow over him. From this perspective, the gender-twisted tyrant's features were more easily visible. A messy ponytail flopped around each time she tried to tear the Super Crown off. Loose bits of it fell off, and strung over her slick skin, drenched from the blaring heat around. Each blazing, irritated breath made her bust wobble, the Power Star rocking dangerously with it - along with the whole great hall. Peach rested in that cage, looking out for a hero.

Wario cracked his knuckles. So, this was "Bowsette"... She was a big challenge, but someone had to rescue that helpless victim of her villainy. And maybe save the princess afterwards. Maybe.

He headed for his destination...

[Suggested music - Paper Mario - Angry Bowser - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C6jARBDG... ]

Even after the Super Crown warped the Koopa monarch to this more svelte form - every ounce of it pulsing with her tense heartbeat - it was clear that Bowsette didn't skip leg days. Its plush muscles formed great curves for Wario to traverse - their firm, hairless surface making him nearly slide off twice from lack of holds for his hands. Either time, he saw tatters of the dark dress strewn across the ground, as if torn apart by sharp claws in anguished throes. It left both legs completely bare, providing zero cover for the loud yellow shirt and purple overalls. All their owner could do was scurry on, silent but deadly, staring at the Power Star within the cleavage above - until he'd reached the titanic seat where the all-consuming silhouette rested...

With a grumble, Bowsette patted the treasure between her chest - the mighty orbs blocking them out save for a golden alpenglow, drawing out details in the pores. She flexed an arm up, staring at her palm. "So, Peach. You know why you're here? I wanna know your body"

Peach turned over her shoulder, through the thick bars. "I... I told you, I won't marry you!"

The Koopa Queen stepped over, staring right at her. Warning sirens flashed in Wario's head as the soles hit the ground. Everything spun around him, turning his face green. The mighty, lumbering stomps shook the new passenger, who barely hung on. His arms trembled, buckling from the strange shaking – it seemed as if she was having trouble balancing her new weight. He could feel a great heat flare up around her torso, then die with a sad whimper. "No! I want to know how you deal with this body. I can't get it to work right!" She gestured from the top of her distant Super Crown to the black heels below. "Like this hair! How do you keep it in place? The second I take it out of a ponytail, it gets all stringy and wild! I can't run an army with that mess!"

What could Peach say? "Uhm... What kind of hairbrush do... you use?" She looked around for an exit. A kidnapping for beauty tips... This went past the usual levels of terrifying.

"Hairbrush?" The great pillar Wario hung on wavered a little as she put a hand to her hip. As Bowsette leaned closer to stare skeptically at his prisoner in pink, the bandit felt gravity shift, and grasped tightly to the hard skin. "What's a hairbrush?"

From below, the shrunken invader put a palm to his face. "Come on – even I groom sometimes! What kind of living standards did they have in the Koopa Kingdom?" As he shout-whispered, he found his spot shifting downwards, plump cheek grinding against the sweat-soaked surface of the leg. Without the support, he instantly began sliding down, undoing all the progress he made. His gloves clutched for the spotless flesh, unable to slow his descent...

Until he bit into the flesh. Finally, he stopped, legs dangling right above the hill-like knee.

Fiddling in her pockets, Peach took out her own rosy-tinted hairbrush, and handed it through her cage towards the bulkier woman. "Here... But, Bowsette, I... think the ponytail suits you." She turned away. "You can use this, but your hair doesn't have to match mine..."

One of Bowsette's legs ascended for a solitary, rage-filled stomp - lifting Wario with it, higher and higher. His grip slipped right at that moment. Wind blowing through his mustache, he flew off the muscular plane, flapping helplessly in midair. The titaness in black snatched the brush brusquely. Seeing his chance, he clenched his teeth and grabbed for the bristles. His steady arms clutched around a set of said bristles, touched with a trace of blonde hair - before pulling him up at light speed. The Power Star flew past him in a blur, barely out of reach.

"No! Waaah!"

The thief's call for help was naught but a whistle, soon smothered by the split ends and knots among Bowsette's scalp. She sneered at Peach smugly, as if she'd achieved some victory - tiny cinders sparking out from the upturned side of her grin. "Gwahaha! You think you can hog all the style for yourself? Fat chance! You're mine, and now your hair is good as mine, too!"

This heralded a new obstacle for Wario: that massive hand began combing her locks with the grace and elegance of a speed metal band's guitarist. With feverish tugs, it forced him through fields of waving hairs, curling around him. He swung back, tearing hairs out; only for more, still, to engulf him with the next stroke. The surface receded more than the legs he'd just climbed - but that only meant it drove deeper into his face, itching his nose madly. When he could glimpse anything but that shaggy surface, it was a bit of that pink tiara's top, the cause of all this trouble. Helpless, thrashing, he was utterly trapped in the newly-crowned princess' first grooming. It was like being stuck in Dr. Crygor's Gravitator all over again - only far less clean.

Peach smiled a troubled smile - that of a patient older sister trying her best to play along with a game of make-believe. Seeing this, Bowsette suddenly stopped. "Wait! Is this some kinda trap?" She tore it out of her head, the sound of painful ripping echoing out loudly. There was nothing on it but messy clumps within the bristles; but still, this just made her feel dumb. She handed it back in the cage. "ARGH! Who needs brushing, anyway!"

Peach squinted at her belonging. "Careful, please..." Was something moving in there?

Stuck on the brush, wrapped in hairs like a cocoon that tied him against the pink plastic, Wario tilted around. He tried biting through the rope at his wrists; all that did was send grease down into his gullet. Darn it - couldn't this Koopa girl make up her mind? The Power Star was getting further away...

Curling his legs up, and launching them forward, the criminal sent himself flying in the stringy ball. He leaned towards a spike protruding from the great cuff before him, surrounding her upper arm. It pierced right into the ball, cutting the constricting hair off him; save for two strands he hung by, climbing up the great cliff of her shoulder. Excellent! The first Goomba, from behind his back, revealed a Super Crown. "Maybe I don't understand... But I'll follow my leader, no matter where that takes me!" He placed it on his mushroomy head. With a POOF, the minion became a brown-haired princess with a glare of senseless determination.

The Boo followed suit quickly, equipping her own crown. Replacing the white blob was a pale, ghastly maiden, with a slobbering tongue hanging loose. "Haha! This is horrifying. I love it!"

Another POOF from the side - and where the odd Koopa Troopa once stood was a short girl, somewhat like the Koopa Queen herself, in a green dress.

A set of multiple poofs rang out through the room; multiple Shy Gals now stood chattering around, in every colour of the rainbow. One with a shapely form in red and light green hair over her mask shrugged. "If you can't beat 'em..."

Bowsette, with crossed arms, tried to hold herself back; but ended up giving a hearty laugh, crossing her cuffed arms together. "Gwahahaha! How the heck did you guys get all these Super Crowns?"

From the side, a girl with cute round glasses and blue pyjamas snickered in response. "This is... the final boss weapon, my liege. Simple duplication magic to confuse the enemy. But really, I didn't plan for them to all do this at once." Kamek looked over the display, then back to Bowsette, standing proud in the center. Flames shot out of the queen's mouth in contentment.

"Well, of course! Of course they still love me, Koopa or not!" She cheered, a few tears streaming from her lashes; which she quickly flung off. "I'm a buncha things, Kamek. But here, I am queen!" Soon, there were few baddies that weren't transformed into girls just like her - whether grinning Chain Chomps, dashing Bullet Bills, bespectacled Lakitus, or heavy-booted Thwomps. It spread like a wave, washing over the dark room. "And what's weird, is all of this is thanks to..."

A chill ran up her spine.

"WARIO!"

Her shout silenced everyone instantly, as they turned to their beloved leader. In the commotion, Wario had taken his Power Star and bolted for it. He nudged his way past a Shy Gal's heel, and now ran through the door. Hearing the shout, he began laughing in victory. "Wahaha, a happy ending for everyone!"

His laughter stopped when the Goomba princess stepped on him. She twisted her heel, rubbing the mark on her head. "Vengeance! My people shall have vengeance, criminal!"

The blow made him drop the glowing treasure. It bounced across the floor. Minions scrambled for it - but clashed into each other, jamming the doorway, and trampling the thief inadvertently. Finally, after a few more bounces, it landed in the hands of...

"Thank you so much, Wario, for to finding our star!"

Mario picked up the glowing Power Star, holding it high. What?

Following him, Luigi stumbled forward, Princess Peach's cage on his back. Using the star with its lock, Mario freed her. They applauded in glee at their victory, Peach blowing kisses to both brothers - until she turned to see the room nearby. All three faces sank in confusion at the horde of princesses scurrying over each other, Bowsette screaming orders and insults in the distance. Taken aback with horror at a Booette crawling out, Luigi shut the door.

From underneath it, Wario scurried out, his body bruised and broken. "It's not fair! I worked hard for that star! I knew you were coming, but not that soon!" He chewed at his cap, tearing it apart. "I want my reward!"

Accordingly, the titanic Peach leaned down, and planted a large, wet smooch that encompassed his face. "Thank you, Wario. Your quest is now over. We will remember you forever as a hero."

He growled back. "What good is that? How am I supposed to sell that in Rogueport, or ransom it off for money?"

With a heavy pound, Bowsette forced the door open, knocking the Mario Bros. aside. The horde of baddies stood back in wait, looking over their beloved boss. Peach drew back, shaking, as the rivalling monarch's large hand approached... And landed on her puffy shoulder.

The queen bowed her head. "Thanks." She glared up. "Now get out with your two plumbers. You won't escape next time!"

Peach bowed, putting her hand to Bowsette's cheek. "If you need any help with the crown..."

"Don't test me!... Jerk." With a hum, the queen got both Mario Brothers back to their feet, confused, and pushed them out. Peach followed, but was looking back. What about the third capped man, who retrieved the star from the danger of Bowsette's clutches?

Suddenly, a pressure lifted from Bowsette's head. In a POOF, the crown was off. Instead of the curvy, dark-dressed queen was a bulky, red-haired Koopa grumbling in confusion. Wario slid off the now-normalized Bowser's back, carrying the Super Crown in hand - and rushing off after the other heroes. "Wahaha! Now this, I can get rich from!" He drooled, eyes in the air. "I'll send out a message: 'I am a wealthy Mushroom princess in need of help. Please send your money to Princess Wario at-'"

"Get him!" Bowser commanded to his troop. Immediately, a troop of girls rushed to capture the fleeing Wario, marching over each other to please their monarch. "Get my crown back!"

Kamek, still with his crown on, tugged at Bowser's leg. "Sir? I thought you wanted that off. And anyway, we can find another..."

"It might come in handy!" Bowser growled, looking to the marching women, and following after with clumsy steps. "Prize for the first minion who can retrieve my precious crown!"

1532.content:
9-Volt grumbled a bit as he made his way home. The weather was perfect in Diamond City right now, the snow was finally melting and spring was making its way out of slumber, but 9-Volt himself felt none of the cheer going around at the moment. His mom had caught him playing games in bed the previous night, and confiscated his 3DS until he could prove he'd take his school studies seriously. It wasn't like he was flunking! He was doing just fine, and had even found a way to turn around his math grades too! She insisted he'd ruin his health and grades at this rate though, and her word was law...he was also half sure that his mom took it from him to play herself. And when he complained about it to Fronk, all he got was some mumbo jumbo about truly enjoying his youth while he had it.

9-Volt was so caught up in his thoughts and not paying attention that he didn't look up to see that he was about to bump into a certain red imp, who also seemed quite distracted. Red was caught in a conundrum. Ashley had told him to go out and get a human volunteer for her latest potion, one that she insisted would grant her a tremendous boon if it had been mixed properly. Red himself wasn't so sure that this'd end well, but he was more than happy to not be the test dummy this time. Something to do with it needing to work on a human specifically. Red had thought he was in the clear until Ashley send him out to find some sucker to rope into this. Her shyness got the best of her, not that he'd dare bring that fact up. Red pondered who to get, and his mind of course wandered to their odd circle of acquaintances...Orbulon, Dribble, and Spitz were out...possibly Wario too, who knew WHAT that guy was. Penny and Crygor were more likely to scoff at the idea of a magic potion, despite the various formulas they made...maybe Jimmy then?

It was then that the two wandering suck-employees of WarioWare Inc bumped into each other, knocking each other down.

"Hey, what gives, I was-Oh...9-Volt! Hey hey pal!" Red saw the young helmet wearing kid dusting himself off as he stood up, it was then that Red saw that he looked kinda glum.

"Oh, hey Red...how's it going?" 9-Volt said, the lack of enthusiasm evident in his voice. Red frowned slightly at this as he floated over to the young kid.

"What's got ya down squirt?" Red hadn't really talked to many of the employees outside of Ashley, but he did appreciate 9-Volt to a degree. He, Kat, Ana, Young Cricket, and Penny had managed to break her out of her shell a bit with trick or treating, and there was that potluck that 5-Volt held too...

"Oh, it's nothing much really, just got my games taken away for a bit..." 9-Volt sounded more down that Red would expect for such a reason. He knew the kid was absolutely loco crazy for games, especially Nintendo ones...that's when Red got an idea. A potentially devious idea...ah well, it wasn't like Ashley's potions ever were lethal, and besides, he bet the kid would have fun with what he had to offer.

"You know 9-Volt...if you wanted to come over to Ashley's mansion, I have a Switch~" Red said, in an easy going voice. He'd won the thing in a raffle and had a blast with it...until he couldn't play it anymore at least.

"A Switch!? Really!? Do you have-"

"The new Zelda? Sure do. Tell ya what, why don't you come over, try it out!" Red said, genuinely offering a good time to the child. Of course, there was the catch, though that shouldn't be an issue.

"I dunno Red, my mom would flip if I didn't get home on time, and besides...I thought Ashley hated guests."

"Whaaaaat? Whatever gave you that idea?" Red asked, trying to play it off.

"The fact that she said if any of us set foot in her mansion she'd turn us into newts." 9-Volt said, deadpan.

"She was exaggerating, for effect! Besides, even if she did you'd get better." Red said. 9-Volt frowned.

"I really do want to try the Switch though..." His mom promised if he got all A's on his final grades this year, though she'd settle for a B in gym then he could get a Switch for his Summer break...but that was 3 months away, practically a lifetime, and he was being offered the chance to play it now! Just a taste...though he was still hesitant. It wasn't that he hated Ashley, and in fact he did think the witch was fun to be around at times. But he also knew just how prickly she could be, and just how powerful she was. She was easily the second most intimidating person he knew, second only to his mom.

"...And Ashley won't turn me into a newt?" 9-Volt asked.

"I promise! well probably not. Actually, she sent me out to find someone to do her a favor! And you might be just the guy for it!" Red said. 9-Volt tilted his head at this.

"Really? Ashley needs a favor? What is it?" Now he was curious. He never knew her to ask anyone for help aside from Red.

"Well, why don't you let her explain it to you, come on, let's get going to the mansion!" Red said, floating ahead of 9-Volt, down the path towards his home.

"Hey wait up!...I hope this is worth it...I really want to use that paraglider." 9-Volt said, trailing behind the red imp, slightly slower.

As the sun started to set on their walk, 9-Volt felt himself audibly gulp at the foreboding clouds above. He didn't know if she was behind it, the weather was behind it, or somehow the very forces of nature itself knew, but there was always a dark and looming atmosphere when it came to Ashley's mansion. On Halloween it was certainly festive, but now, here alone it was bringing its own tension to the young boy.

"S-so, uh...is it true that you c-can really go anywhere in Breath of the Wild?" 9-Volt asked.

"Huh? Oh uh, yeah! Pretty much after the first hour or so." Red said, not sure why the kid was so stuttery.

Red casually floated towards the entrance of the mansion, 9-Volt still following, much slower as he almost felt like the mansion itself would eat him if he stepped in. He had never seen the inside...but the outside was more than enough to frighten anyone away.

"Come on kid, she's inside!" Evidently 9-Volt hadn't even walked up the steps, he almost looked petrified as Red rolled his eyes. "Look, I promise that i'm bringing you here on Ashley's request. She ain't gonna do anything to hurt you!" Red was starting to get impatient, but 9-Volt finally started to ascend the stairs to the mansion, and eventually...enter the door.

He didn't know what he expected inside. A dilapidated mansion with cobwebs, a dark horrific dungeon, an entryway to some nightmare dimension!

Instead it was kind homey. A nice, well lit mansion. He saw a small table, some books, the entire place seemed candle lit. 9-Volt frowned at this. He actually didn't see much in terms of electricity at all!

"Hey Red, where's the TV, for the Switch?" 9-Volt asked, confused. Maybe it was in a different room?

"Oh, there isn't one."

"...So you played it in handheld mode?" 9-Volt asked, now starting to feel like maybe he was duped.

"I did...until the battery died." Red confirmed.

"So you didn't charge it?" 9-Volt had to confirm it.

"Don't have the means sadly...sorry 9-Volt, but if you do this i'll let ya have the thing!" Red said. 9-Volt's eyes widened at this. He could OWN a Switch if he went through with this!?

"Really!? Okay Red, what does Ashley need!" 9-Volt sounded enthused as he heard a quiet, but firm voice behind him.

"You're too loud. Be quiet." He gulped as he turned around to see that familiar witch. Her red dress, her black hair in pigtails, and those piercing, commanding red eyes...there she was, Ashley.

"Oh, sorry...um, Red said you needed a favor? And something about giving me his Switch if I do it...?" 9-Volt asked quietly, almost timid. Ashley eyed the little Imp before returning her attention to 9-Volt.

"Yes, that seems reasonable. 9-Volt, come with me. I promise this won't take long." Ashley turned her back to 9-Volt, proceeding into another hallway leading to who knows where. 9-Volt gathered up his courage and ventured behind her, leaving the red imp where he was.

"Good luck kid...because yeesh will you need it." He muttered, glad to be free of his duty. "Now where did I put that Switch...?"

As 9-Volt passed a variety of rooms and closed doors, he almost wanted to ask some questions about them, but bit his tongue. He did not want to say or do anything that would slight the young girl leading him, and she seemed content to not say a word. As he followed behind though he noticed a sense of dread creeping its way into his head.

It was then that he was led into what looked to be a room full of various rainbow colored vials and chemicals, a potion room...and Ashley procured a light blue looking potion from a nearby table.

"I merely need you to drink this, and allow me to observe the results." Ashley said, in her usual monotone.

"Oh uh...okay, and it won't...do anything bad to me?" 9-Volt asked. Ashley didn't change her expression.

"If my mixing is correct, you should lose about 2 centimeters of your current height...that is it." Ashley said.

"Oh, that's it...? Why do you care abo-" Ashley started to glare and 9-Volt took the hint to shut up. Her look softened though as she saw how scared 9-Volt looked.

"...I'm too tall." Ashley finally muttered.

"Oh...okay then?" 9-Volt certainly didn't think so. If anything she seemed short for her age, but he knew better than to argue.

Taking the vial in his hands he braced himself...this was for a Switch he encouraged himself, as he gulped down the potion.

"Ugh! Bitter..." He muttered, before he felt his vision start to swim.

"Ashley...I don't feel good..." He muttered, and before long his consciousness started to fade...though his last sight was certainly odd. It almost looked like...Ashley was getting much, much larger than he.

9-Volt started to feel consciousness return to him as he groaned. He didn't quite open his eyes yet, but his whole body felt stiff. He was laying on something soft he noted, and something that felt like a heavy blanket was on top of him. Though the texture of it felt...odd. He groaned before also realizing that his head felt lighter...and exposed. He didn't have his helmet on! He snapped his eyes open as he looked around. His surroundings were alien to him, he was on a soft surface that expanded out quite a ways in each direction, and looking at each edge it looked like a solid plummet to a hard floor. The thing that had been covering him was black and looked to be a large blanket...and the last thing he noticed was he was...with a blush he looked around and found his clothes, promptly putting them on as he started to wonder just what was going on. He was glad to be with his helmet again as he breathed a sigh of relief.

Let's see, he had taken that potion from Ashley that was supposed to take off a few centimeters of height, and it was then that he passed out. As these thoughts came, he felt a small boom. It wasn't much, but it caught him off guard. Another, closer and slightly more powerful one followed that as something was coming. Something large...and as he looked towards its direction he noted what looked to be a looming, giant entryway into here...in fact, it looked like a doorway. And the surface he was on...reminded him a lot of a bed. And the looming shelves, and...

9-Volt felt a chill run down his spine as he thought he knew what had happened to him, and in a few seconds his fears were confirmed as the booms revealed themselves to be the main reason for his current problem.

Looming high, far above him was the largest living thing he'd seen. Someone that would rival possibly even WarioWare Inc. Headquarters. Or would at least be larger than any other building in Diamond City. With her red flowing dress, piercing red eyes that now struck him as orbs that, when fixed on him, reminded him of the feeling he had when his mom would check on him at night. Her pigtails, now looked to be extensions of this impossibly large beast that was looking right at him. He couldn't help but cower as he saw Ashley, and she crossed the threshold that was her door, proceeding towards the diminished boy.

"9-Volt...the potion I used on you was a failure. I'm sorry for that." She said, her voice calm even as her face looked slightly more downtrodden than usual.

9-Volt surmised that this was NOT the intended effect then...which meant this didn't go according to Ashley's or Red's plan. He was almost afraid to ask, but he needed to do it. "Y-you can fix this, right?" 9-Volt asked, his voice coming out as a bit of a squeak to the mediocre witch before him.

"I've already got Red out procuring ingredients that should grow you back. I was able to shrink your clothes down, but for now i'm afraid that it might take some time. I did at least manage to perfect the potion I used on you though, and it did work. I managed to knock two centimeters off." She gave a small smile at this.

The difference in HER height though, was not apparent to 9-Volt as she was larger than he'd ever seen her by a ridiculous margin. It would be comical to consider her shorter than she'd been just a few hours ago, but that only reinforced how absolutely puny 9-Volt himself was. And another, potentially more horrifying fact loomed in his head as he considered just how much time had probably passed.

"Ashley, what time is it?" He asked, dreading the answer as she tilted her head.

"It's probably around 11 or so now." She stated simply as his stomach plummeted, the giant witch coming closer to the bed, reinforcing how giant she was.

"Oh no! I am so dead! Mom is going to kill me!" 9-Volt lamented as Ashley sighed.

"As it stands I could call her with my wand if you want her to pick you up." Ashley said, almost like that wouldn't be an issue. Was she trying to get rid of him right now until the potion was done? If his mom found out what he did, he didn't only fear for himself...but he feared for Ashley. Magical abilities or no, his mom was downright horrifying when angered, and he'd bet his entire Game & Watch collection on her coming out on top. Still, he didn't know if staying with the witch was a better solution to his problems either, considering how isolated she was it would maybe be better to at least be with his mom who he knew could take care of him, even if she'd never let him...play....games again...9-Volt was caught in a terrible situation when a third option came to mind, though he didn't know if Ashley would feel insulted by him trying to find alternative means to cure him.

"Could I just stay here for now?" 9-Volt asked. A part of him knew he'd need to own up to his mom sooner than later, but right now he'd rather not face her while at this size. Ashley looked at him a bit perplexed. "I don't know if that's a good idea 9-Volt, i'm sure your mom is worried sick, isn't she?" Ashley said, with a bit of a gentler demeanor than the tiny Nintendo fanboy had expected. This made 9-Volt hesitate as he could only imagine that his mom was probably freaking out right now, and a pang of guilt hit him. He looked down, avoiding looking up at Ashley's gaze.

"How long do you think it'll take for you to brew that potion to grow me back?" He asked. He didn't look up, hoping that maybe it wouldn't take TOO long.

"Probably about a day to brew, Red just needed to grab some ingredients. As it stands you'd be in my way more than anything if you stayed here." Ashley said, being far blunter about her feelings on the matter. 9-Volt bit his lip as he finally found the courage to look up at her.

"Would it be possible to at least hold off on calling her until tomorrow maybe...?" 9-Volt asked. Tomorrow was a school day, and there was no way he'd be able to go like this, though he didn't know if that was what he should be worrying about. His whole mind right now was kinda scattershot as he looked up at Ashley. She let off a sigh and closed her eyes for a second in thought.

"It is probably late to be calling her. Very well 9-Volt, we'll discuss it in the morning then." She opened her eyes and locked eyes with the tiny elementary school student and offered a tiny, brief smile. 9-Volt felt a wave of relief course through him before his heart started to beat rapidly again at her next action, as fingers with enough strength in them to crush him started to reach down. He felt an instinctive fear course through him as he fell to his rear and inched away from her. It was then that the fingers hesitated as Ashley saw this, and her face fell to her default frown.

"9-Volt, i'm going to need to pick you up off of my bed." She said, sounding slightly impatient. 9-Volt gulped before he had an idea. "Couldn't you just...lower your hand and let me climb into it maybe?" He asked. Ashley wanted to roll her eyes, she wasn't going to hurt the kid, but it didn't hurt to let him feel safe. He did offer to be her test subject, and the final brew of the potion had the results she wanted.

"Alright then." Ashley laid her hand flat, palm up down on her bed, near the little Nintendo aficionado as he looked forward at it, taking some hesitant steps towards it. Her hand was large enough for him to lay down on and stretch out he felt like...and something about that made him uneasy. Someone being so big felt unnatural, but then again, it was him that was small right now.

He was walking slowly towards her palm and Ashley was losing her patience entirely at his hesitation. "Hurry up or i'm breaking that Nintendo thing Red promised you." She said without a hint of warmth. 9-Volt gulped as he scrambled for the palm of her hand, climbing on top of it and settling in as she looked down, her red glare piercing.

"There, that wasn't such a big deal, now was it?" She said, almost a growl as 9-Volt gulped, maybe he would be better off with his mom...

His stomach started to lurch as she raised her palm up, lifting him from the bed and giving him an intense feeling of vertigo. 9-Volt closed his eyes as he didn't want to look down, but he felt and heard Ashley's powerful movements as she went to leave her bedroom. Her movements caused him to be well aware of his precarious position, and as she went to turn around a corner, the movement caused him to fall to his side, and force him to look at the far below ground. With a gulp he got up and gripped her thumb as hard as he could, causing Ashley to look at him. She let off a weary sigh.

"I'm not going to drop you either. Stop this nonsense 9-Volt." She said.

'Easy for you to say...you're not the one the size of a rat!' 9-Volt thought as she kept walking, him still clinging to her thumb. She wasn't going to bother anymore. It was then that 9-Volt noticed that they were approaching a great wide square with a white tarp...er, tablecloth on it. And there was...food!

9-Volt felt his stomach grumble as he realized how hungry he was, and Ashley promptly lowered her hand to the table to let him off. It was then that he saw a giant bit of cheese, with some crackers as big as him!

"It isn't much, but feel free to have some." Ashley said as she sat in a chair, leaning one arm on the table and resting her head in the hand that she propped up on it. She and Red had already eaten, but she figured that he needed to eat too. She watched as he happily approached a cheese slice larger than him and tore off a chunk, happily munching on it. He did seem pretty happy right now. She almost felt a smile creep to her face as she observed him. It was then that a loud presence decided to make itself known.

"Hey Ashley! I found the things ya needed to fix 9-Volt!" Red.

The imp was back, and seemed to make a beeline for Ashley's room before she decided it'd be best to call out.

"In the dining room Red." She said, and seconds after, he floated in, looking triumphant as he held a sack at his back...and had a clothespin on his nose.

"What's with the..." Ashley started before her eyes widened and she pinched her own nose as she started coughing. She took a quick look at 9-Volt on the table to realize that he was also pinching his nose, and looked almost ready to retch. She hoped he got enough, because his appetite might be ruined...

"Yeah, the stinking corpse lily kinda lingers." Red said as he looked to Ashley, then the tiny 9-Volt. "So pal, I gotta ask, how is it being that small?" Red found himself floating to the tiny kid, looming over him like some kind of great demon...though 9-Volt was more preoccupied with the horrid stench the imp had brought with him.

"Red, get those to the brewing room." Ashley said, hastily trying to get the presence of the ingredients away from this room. "And get the corpse flower distilled!" She commanded as Red groaned. "Ashley...it's laaaaaaate." He said and she merely offered a glare.

"Alright alright! But i'm just doing the corpse flower for now!" He said as he opted to not spur Ashley's already depleted patience. Ashley let her look linger until Red was out of the room before returning her attention to 9-Volt. Hesitantly, she lowered her fingers from her nose to find that the smell had left, and 9-Volt had returned to eating, though with less enthusiasm. "Once you're done i'm going to bed, we'll figure out where you'll be sleeping too for tonight." Ashley said.

9-Volt looked up at her as his appetite faded and had just one question for now.

"...is a stinking corpse lily necessary to grow me...?" He asked with hesitation. Ashley sighed.

-

9-Volt couldn't help but feel his accommodations were a bit degrading...he was inside of a dresser drawer, with a handkerchief as a blanket and some old shirts as his mattress and pillow. He looked up at the looming visage of Ashley, now out of her familiar red dress and in sleeping pajamas. Her hair was also down, no longer with the pigtails he knew her by, she almost looked like an entirely different person, even her usual intimidating demeanor was gone as she regarded him with what looked to be a light smile.

"This should do fine. I'll see you in the morning." She said, as soon she shut the drawer, effectively cutting 9-Volt off from the dim light outside, and the rest of the world. He hoped tomorrow would see things get better...hopefully with his size restored, a Switch, and only grounded for HALF of the rest of his life by his mom.

info.brief_description: The greedy anti-hero turns tiny in a hunt for princess and pirate treasures!
info.description:
Wahahaha! I've done it again! I've got the perfect scheme to rob 'em right from under their noses!

Wario here, losers! In my latest act of genius, I've built a device that lets me shrink down to tiny sizes. Hey - if I could build the Telmet, why not? My plan's so simple, even Waluigi could get it: I run into some treasure piles, grab it all, and slip out incognito. My mouth's watering just thinking about it! Peach's castle gold! That rotten Captain Syrup's booty! Whatever Ashley's been hiding in that mansion! It's all finally going to go to a worthy cause: me!

Oh, but just 'cuz it's simple, doesn't mean it's easy. It's gonna take guts. Which I have. It's gonna take speedy feet. Which I have. And it's gonna take quick thinking. That's where you come in!

When you get to the end of a chapter, select what happens next - and if the path you want isn't there, write it down. Or bribe someone else into doing it. If you make the right choices, I'll have another successful heist! Wahahah! But if you make the wrong choices, and lead me into danger when I'm all tiny... You wouldn't do that, would you?


----------

Greed is good.

Greed makes you do great things.

Greed will get you everything; even if you have to pile-drive your enemies to do so.

Put on your "W" cap and overalls, and let your inner greed run wild! This is a Wario-based shrinking story - loosely inspired by the masterpiece fangame, Wario Date. The mustached scoundrel shrinks down in search of riches to steal.

You may ask: "Is this a joke?" In that case I'd answer: "Only halfway." The setting isn't known for being serious, and this interactive isn't intended to be, either. But if you look at the plump anti-hero and his game series, he has some good stuff going for him.

He's far from a boring blank slate or traditional hero; but trades the darkness and edginess of other anti-heroes for slapstick goofiness. His greed gives him a reason to leap blindly bravely into danger and put his life at risk, and a consistent mission besides "get someone's attention" or "have sex". Wario's potential love interests (and cute girls who hang around him) outnumber those of Mario or Luigi; and his turbulent relationships with these characters make gentle, playful, and violent interactions all in-character for them. His huge ego and exaggerated reactions make it hilarious to see him get knocked down and fail; but all the while, his tenacity and human side make it cathartic to see him succeed. Plus, he has beautiful muscle definition.

Repeat after me: you're the bad guy... But being bad is good, and greed is good!

----------

Here are some quick guidelines:

YOU CAN - be as rough with Wario as you like! He's a sturdy guy, he can take a beating! He can get pancaked, burnt to a crisp, frozen solid, infected with a virus, but he'll always get back into the fray eventually!
BUT - He can't die. This isn't a rule. This is a scientifically proven fact, going from WL2 and WL3. You can end the story, but he has to survive it - even if it means dishing out a fate worse than death.

YOU CAN - use characters from any game or sub-series. That includes Wario Land, WarioWare, Wario World, Wario: Master of Disguise, Wario's Woods, Wario Blast, and any of the Mario universe's cast; along with any linked games, like Rhythm Heaven. Even fancharacters like Bowsette get a pass!
BUT - This is an interactive story; not a web of character choices with no routes coming from them. If you create a choice chapter, at least one choice must lead to a full chapter within 24 hours. Otherwise, I'll delete your choice chapter. This way, we keep it clean! If this rule puts too much stress on you, write your chapter with content in a word processor before you put in a choice chapter that leads to it. The other choices can stay empty for others if you want, that's no problem.

YOU CAN - have female interaction, male interaction, futas, furries, and gross-out stuff. If your greatest fantasy is diving into Jimmy T.'s luxurious afro or Dinomighty's mouth, I'm not gonna judge.
BUT - there'll be a choice for different giant types at the beginning. Keep them in the right route. Out of personal preference, I'll focus my own efforts on female human chapters. Also, as a rule of thumb: if you think the territory you're going in could gross someone out, place an option in the choice chapters that allows them to go in another direction.

YOU CAN - have any kind of interaction with any body part you want! Breasts, butt, feet, vore, noses, insertion, armpits...
BUT - no inflation, muscle gain, weight gain, same-size vore, individual body part growth, object transformation (outside of Wario's injuries), absorption, body swap, or body part removal. Let's keep it focused on size fetishes. If those other fetishes are your thing, here are some great interactives:
https://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/974669-Wario-Ware-Weirdness
https://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/1610829-Ashleys-Swell-adventure
https://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/2153965-Ashley-WG-Story

YOU CAN - include sex, sexual themes, and profanity when appropriate. Who ever heard of a kid-friendly fetish story? Besides Totally Spies, I mean.
BUT - don't use sexual themes with kid characters. (For this story's purposes, that covers Kat, Ana, 9-Volt, 18-Volt, and Lulu. Yes, 18-Volt.) And remember, Wario's not there to get into peoples' pants: he's there to get in their wallets! (Unless their pants happen to be valuable on the market.)

YOU CAN - shrink or grow other characters. The device doesn't have a grow button, but there's always some way! You can also change the viewpoint character. Wario might grab some partners in crime, after all.
BUT - keep the story in third-person POV. No character should be referred to as "you" or "me". And the size-changing device is stationary; unless a new invention or magic comes up, our dashing thief can't grow back at will.

YOU CAN - write chapters as short or as long as you want. I'm not asking for Shakespeare. I'm not asking for sixth-grade reading-level. I'm not even asking for a sixth-grade production of Shakespeare. Do whatever gets you by - and gets Wario closer to the loot! (Or whatever hurts him.)
BUT - before you post, read over your text. Jam it in https://www.grammarcheck.net/editor/ for a grammar check, and https://wordcounter.net/ to see if you've repeated phrases too often. Say the words out loud if you're in a quiet area. If something sounds rotten, try sprucing it up!

----------

A few tips and pieces of inspiration:

-Jokes and wit are just as encouraged as lewdness and action. Have fun with it, and don't be afraid to laugh at the characters sometimes!
-To spice up choice chapters, try putting down what a character is feeling about the decision, what the risks and benefits could be for both, or what's going on in the meantime.
-When the plot's going slow, have a new treasure come up in a dangerous place. A rare brooch in a princess' bosom; a diamond chunk accidentally dropped in food; keys to treasure chests hidden in rear pockets or shoes; these are all perfect bait for a miniaturized thief.
-There's really never a need to put up a "switch to this person's POV" choice. You can always swap perspectives in the middle of the chapter; it's as easy as writing "meanwhile".
-Both the shyer Japanese Ashley and sharper-tongued American Ashley are permitted and appreciated.
-For settings, Wario Land 3 and Wario Land: Shake It! both take place in miniature alternate worlds already. Even outside of that, the world has so many colorful locales - pirate ships, castles, ruins, mansions, rolling plains, toy lands. Use those to your advantage!
-Images of various Wario girls:
http://danbooru.donmai.us/posts/2522251
http://danbooru.donmai.us/posts/1718655
-If you want to get a sense of the a dialogue style I'd like for Wario, here are two great sources:
https://www.mariowiki.com/Talk:Wario%27s_Warehouse
https://www.mariowiki.com/List_of_Wario_quotes
-If you're having trouble with a character, try staying in-character with them. This isn't a limit, this is an opportunity - a way to make them stand out, draw on their experiences in interesting ways, and re-invent game elements. If you want to read up on the games' cast members, see:
http://nintendo.wikia.com/wiki/Category:Wario_characters
http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Characters/Wario?from=Characters.SuperMari...
https://www.mariowiki.com/WarioWare#Characters
-Mood music for brainstorming or accompanying reading:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2_gpqHllF-Q
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EhEAazYMdwM
-Let me know if you're not sure about a chapter idea, I can give some input.
-None of my chapters have any "reserved" paths. If you see a chapter in the story with the owner marked as "TFWNoGiantGF", it means you're free to add to it as you please!
